alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:09AM CDT until June 08 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSTON...WESTERN BRYAN AND MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 1109 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Armstrong to near Mead to 4 miles west of Lake Texoma, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Durant, Madill, Kingston, Colbert, Achille, Silo, Kemp, Mead, Armstrong, Hendrix, Cartwright, Blue, Woodville, Utica, Lebanon, Willis, Little City, Nida, Lake Texoma and Calera. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
